screen.info.faq.title: FAQ
screen.info.faq.subtitle: Quick answers for your Delâilü’l-Hayrât journey.
screen.info.faq.q1.question: What is Delâilü’l-Hayrât?
screen.info.faq.q1.answer: A celebrated collection of salawat upon the Prophet ﷺ compiled by Imam al-Jazuli; many read it weekly as a devotional practice.
screen.info.faq.q2.question: What if I miss a day's reading?
screen.info.faq.q2.answer: Use Missed Days to read in makeup mode. You still gain points, but a bit less than on-time reading.
screen.info.faq.q3.question: How is my progress tracked?
screen.info.faq.q3.answer: Completions, streak, and points stay on your device. You can opt in/out of global ranking anytime.
screen.info.faq.q4.question: Can I change reminder time and language?
screen.info.faq.q4.answer: Yes. Go to Settings to pick your reminder time, toggle missed-day reminders, and change the app language.
screen.info.faq.q5.question: Will there be audio or more content?
screen.info.faq.q5.answer: Audio and richer commentary are planned. You’ll get them via updates—no extra cost.
screen.about.title: About
screen.about.subtitle: Our intention
screen.about.tagline: A calm, intention-first companion for Dalail al-Khayrat.
screen.about.body: This app is built to help you keep a steady Dalail al-Khayrat habit—quietly, privately, and with sincere intention. No ads, no noise, just reminders, tracking, and a gentle reading space.
screen.about.heading: About Delâilü’l-Hayrât
screen.about.whatBody: Delâilü’l-Hayrât is a celebrated collection of prayers for the Islamic prophet Muhammad, authored by the Moroccan Sufi and Islamic scholar Muhammad al-Jazuli. It is one of the most popular and universally acclaimed compilations of blessings upon the Prophet.
screen.about.whoBody: It was written by Imam al-Jazuli, a revered scholar from the 15th century. His dedication and love for the Prophet Muhammad inspired him to compile this work, which has since been cherished by millions of Muslims worldwide.
screen.about.benefitList: Increased love for the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).
Receiving the Prophet's intercession on the Day of Judgment.
Attainment of peace, tranquility, and closeness to the Divine.
Fulfillment of needs and removal of difficulties.
screen.about.adabList: Begin with purity by performing ablution (Wudu).
Face the Qibla (direction of prayer) if possible.
Recite with a sincere heart, mindfulness, and humility.
Reflect upon the meanings of the prayers and the status of the Prophet.
